009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVectorSeparable;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel1D;
017import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
018import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
019
020/**
021 * Separable vector version, for RGB images only (accepts {@link ColorProcessor} only).
022 * This class implements a bilateral filter as proposed in
023 * C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images",
024 * Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision,
025 * Bombay, India.
026 * The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all 
027 * image types.
028 * 
029 * @author W. Burger
030 * @version 2021/01/01
031 */
032public class BilateralFilterVectorSeparable extends GenericFilterVectorSeparable implements BilateralF {
033        
034        private final float[] Hd;       // the 1D domain kernel
035        private final int K;            // the domain kernel size [-K,...,K]
036        private final double sigmaR2;
037        private final VectorNorm colorNorm;
038        private final double colorScale2;
039        
040        public BilateralFilterVectorSeparable() {
041                this(new Parameters());
042        }
043        
044        public BilateralFilterVectorSeparable(Parameters params) {
045                GaussianKernel1D kernel = new GaussianKernel1D(params.sigmaD);
046                this.Hd = kernel.getH();
047                this.K = kernel.getXc();
048                this.sigmaR2 = sqr(params.sigmaR);
049                this.colorNorm = params.colorNormType.create();
050                this.colorScale2 = sqr(colorNorm.getScale(3));
051        }
052        
053        @Override
054        protected float[] doPixelX(PixelPack source, int u, int v) {
055                return filterPixelXY(source, u, v, true);
056        }
057
058        @Override
059        protected float[] doPixelY(PixelPack source, int u, int v) {
060                return filterPixelXY(source, u, v, false);
061        }
062        
063        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
064        
065        private float[] filterPixelXY(PixelPack source, int u, int v, boolean isX) {
066                float[] S = new float[3];       // sum of weighted RGB (initialized to zero)
067                float W = 0;                                            // sum of weights
068                float[] a = source.getPix(u, v);
069                for (int m = -K; m <= K; m++) {
070                        final float[] b = (isX) ? source.getPix(u + m, v) : source.getPix(u, v + m);
071                        float wd = Hd[m + K];                                                                                           // domain weight
072                        float wr = similarityGauss(a, b);
073                        float w = wd * wr;
074                        S[0] = S[0] + w * b[0];
075                        S[1] = S[1] + w * b[1];
076                        S[2] = S[2] + w * b[2];
077                        W = W + w;
078                }
079                S[0] = S[0] / W;
080                S[1] = S[1] / W;
081                S[2] = S[2] / W;
082                return S;
083        }
084        
085        // ------------------------------------------------------
086        
087        // This returns the weights for a Gaussian range kernel (color vector version):
088        private float similarityGauss(float[] A, float[] B) {
089                double d2 = colorScale2 * colorNorm.distance2(A, B);
090                return (float) Math.exp(-d2 / (2 * sigmaR2));
091        }
092
093}
